changelog.name: Segue

version.new: New "Site-Members" group enables: associating users with a site, setting roles for many users at once, and provides support for self-registration.
Plugins: New "Join Site" plugin allows for self-registration to the "Site-Members" group.
version.change: Create Site: Class-sites now have the class group added by default.
Plugins: Plugin internal links now include site parameters.
Plugins: Plugin authorization callbacks can now be object methods.
version.fix: UI1: Fixed classic-mode error when displaying a page with content in the menu that is not visible.
version.change: Roles: Choose-Agent window now includes Agent-info links for all agents, not just search results.
version.fix: Text-Templates: Audio text-template now doesn't cause the 'read more' links to appear.
Roles: Roles wizard now doesn't loose the current editing module when changing site-membership.
Plugins: Audio Player now allows use of 'audio/mpeg3' MIME type sometimes used by OS X.

version.releaseNotes:
This release also fixes a number of of minor bugs. See the change-log for details.
----
Upgrades from versions prior to 2.2.5.0 require running system updaters located under Admin Tools --> Segue Updates.
----
This Segue release uses Harmoni 1.9.4 and Polyphony 1.5.1.
version.fix: CourseManagement: Updated the winter/spring-term change-over to reflect Midd's dates this year.
Migration: Migration now won't die on corrupted Segue 1 exports that include empty agent ids.
Plugins: TextBlock plugin now doesn't show the "read more" link always.
Wiki: Wiki-links that include diacritics now resolve properly.

version.releaseNotes:
This release adds a new tracking module to allow users to see their own actions within a site and editors to see all of the actions within a site.
The Tags plugin has been significantly improved to allow choosing of the part of the site from which tags are displayed. This could be the entire site or just a section or page. The Tags plugin also gains display-options for ordering, display-style (cloud/list), and number of tags to show.
This release also fixes a number of additional minor bugs. See the change-log for details.
----
Upgrades from versions prior to 2.2.5.0 require running system updaters located under Admin Tools --> Segue Updates.
----
This Segue release uses Harmoni 1.9.4 and Polyphony 1.5.0.
version.fix: UI1: Classic-mode plugin editing now doesn't get a javascript error for plugins that do not natively support the wizard.
version.new: Tags: The Tags plugin now supports selection of the part of the site from which to display tags.
Tags: The Tags plugin now supports display options for ordering, cloud versus list, and number of items to show.
Tracking: Have added a participation module that allows any user to track their contributions to a site and allows site editors to view all contributions to nodes they are editors of.
version.fix: Comments: added anchor to comments to allow linking to individual comments
History: changed the compare selected revisions form action to post so form fields will work with urls that don't use path info
Portal: Page title now doesn't have form-text in it.
UI2: Fixed XHTML validation error in edit-mode output.

version.releaseNotes:
This release fixes a number of issues with editing in Internet Explorer 7.
----
Upgrades from versions prior to 2.2.5.0 require running system updaters located under Admin Tools --> Segue Updates.
----
This Segue release uses Harmoni 1.9.3 and Polyphony 1.4.11.
version.fix: UI2: Fixed up options panel styles for IE 7. Now has nicer padding around the edges.
UI2: New-mode options panels now display properly in IE 7, no longer falling behind other elements.
version.change: UI2: New-mode editing interface now always shows borders and controls to improve speed. The browser no longer has to process hundreds of mouse-over/mouse-out events when moving the mouse or scrolling.
version.fix: MediaLibrary: Fixed Safari CSS issue in the MiddMedia library.

version.releaseNotes:
This release fixes a few minor issues with the media library and improves support for Middlebury's MiddMedia service.
See the change log for more details.
----
Upgrades from versions prior to 2.2.5.0 require running system updaters located under Admin Tools --> Segue Updates.
----
This Segue release uses Harmoni 1.9.3 and Polyphony 1.4.11.
version.fix:
MediaLibrary: File library now reloads every time the media library opens.
When repeatedly adding files and making both image and text-links to them the listings in the two panels would get out of sync. Now they are reloaded every time the panel is opened.
MediaLibrary: Fixed Javascript error in IE 7 that occurred when opening a plugin for editing.
version.new: MediaLibrary: MiddMedia library now displays thumbnails for videos.
MediaLibrary: MiddMedia library now displays embeded previews of media.
MediaLibrary: MiddMedia library now displays a link to help in the LIS wiki.
MediaLibrary: MiddMedia library now allows refreshing of the file list.

version.releaseNotes:
This release adds support for external media libraries with support for Middlebury's new MiddMedia service included. A new 'audio' text-template is included for embedding an MP3 player in TextAndImages blocks and text-areas now get an 'Embed Audio/Video' button. When migrating sites from Segue1 installations, mp3 downloads are now converted to AudioPlayer plugins. The Portal styling has been updated to better highlight the selected folder.
See the change log for more details.
----
Upgrades from versions prior to 2.2.5.0 require running system updaters located under Admin Tools --> Segue Updates.
----
This Segue release uses Harmoni 1.9.2 and Polyphony 1.4.10.
version.new: MediaLibrary: Added support for additional external MediaLibrary tabs.
MediaLibrary: Added new MiddMedia tab for browsing the MiddMedia Service.
version.fix: MediaLibrary: After uploads in Safari, MediaLibrary panel is now moved to front again.
version.change:
MediaLibrary: Now supports configuration of which libraries to enable.
This allows some plugins (such as file for download) to restrict to only local files.
version.new: Plugins: Added a button to embed audio/video into text areas.
version.change: Text-Templates: Video template now supports new MiddMedia service
version.new: Text-Templates: Added new Audio text-template for displaying MP3 files in-line.
version.change: User-Data: UserData javascript is now consistantly written once and only once.
version.fix: Portal: Added folder title to Portal header and more prominent selected link styling to help users better see current view of their portal
version.new: Migration: Segue v1 file-for-download blocks with .mp3 files now converted to v2 AudioPlayer plugin content blocks.

version.releaseNotes:
This release adds support for creating new content through wiki-links.
----
Upgrades from versions prior to 2.2.5.0 require running system updaters located under Admin Tools --> Segue Updates.
----
This Segue release uses Harmoni 1.8.6 and Polyphony 1.4.9.
version.new: Wiki: Wiki links to titles that do not match existing pages now link to a form that allows creation of new pages, sections or content blocks.

version.releaseNotes:
This release fixes a character-encoding issue in which some Russian text became garbled due to incorrect encoding conversion.
----
Upgrades from versions prior to 2.2.5.0 require running system updaters located under Admin Tools --> Segue Updates.
----
This Segue release uses Harmoni 1.8.6 and Polyphony 1.4.9.

This release fixes a number of bugs found by users over the past few months, improving migration, the audio plugin, documentation, RSS display, and a few other issues. See the change-log for details.
----
Upgrades from versions prior to 2.2.5.0 require running system updaters located under Admin Tools --> Segue Updates.
----
This Segue release uses Harmoni 1.8.5 and Polyphony 1.4.9.
version.fix: Migration: Site XSD now allows colons and hyphens in the tag content to match real allowed values.
Plugins: Audio plugin now allows choosing audio of MIME type audio/mpg as well as audio/mpeg.
Migration: Export now skips media assets with no media file.
Migration/Plugins: Export and HTML cleaning now convert text to UTF-8 and strip control chars.
Roles: Choose-User list now doesn't crash if a deleted agent had been given roles.
UI2: Add-site form now includes additional help text on setting site-wide roles.
UI2: Add-site form now includes additional help text on templates and themes.
UI1: Paste-panel now works in Classic-mode.
SiteDisplay/UI2: Can no longer set fixed organizers to too few rows/columns. The FixedOrganizerSiteComponent now checks for internal consistency when changing the number of rows and columns
RSS: The RSS Feed Display can now load protected feeds from alternate segue location categories, allowing feeds from 'community' to be displayed in 'main'.
Roles: Documented lack of effective-dates in Role-setting UI.
Plugins: Links to Segue simple-form urls (/sites/sitename) now do not get stripped to the Segue base-URL when editing content.

version.releaseNotes:
This release add the ability to make empty site-placeholders aliases to placeholders that contain sites. This enables sites to be moved and have users redirected from the old urls. As well making multiple course-section-placeholders aliases to a single site for the course can allow that site to show up under the 'current classes' listing for students in all sections of the course.
The user interface for copying sites has now been merged with the user-interface for copying content for a more consistent user experience.
The 2.2.5.5 bug-fix release adds further fixes authenticated RSS feeds
See the change-log for details on additional fixes and improvements.
----
Upgrades from versions prior to 2.2.5.0 require running system updaters located under Admin Tools --> Segue Updates.
----
This Segue release uses Harmoni 1.8.4 and Polyphony 1.4.8.
version.fix: RSS: Authenticated RSS feeds now work again due to a fix in Harmoni 1.8.4.

Tagging: Fixed file path in tag actions to point at new plugins-dist directory.
Attribution: Straightened out attribution printing so that authors could be shown without dates.

version.fix: Installation: Updated 'slot' table SQL so that updaters do not need to be run for new installations.
Installation: Reordered SQL files so that new installations will succeed.
Installation: Plugin SQL files now get run automatically on install.
Installation: New installations now have a 'jadministrator-test_site' placeholder added so that it is straightforward how to create a site and test if Segue is operational.

version.new: Placeholders: Placeholders can now be made aliases of other placeholders. This allows automatic redirects to the target site as well as allowing sites to display under additional names in users' portals.
Placeholders: In addition to copying, sites can now be moved to a new placeholder, keeping their node-ids and perma-links valid.
version.important: Run the 'Aliases' updater under Admin Tools -> Segue Updates.
version.change: Site-Copy and Component-Copy are now unified and both use the selection and paste panel for consistency.
Plugins: Divided plugins into distributed and local directories.
version.fix: UI2: In the 'Paste' panel, the Move/Copy button label now properly reflects the selected action when the panel is first opened.
Text-Templates: Pop-up window text-template now accepts https URLs.
Media: File urls are now properly matched when a filename is appended to the URL.
Plugins: RSS Feed plugin now doesn't display Javascript errors in Firefox when navigating to another page before feeds have loaded.
Authentication: Now doesn't jump around to other pages when logging out.
UI2: 'Read More' links are now shown and hidden dynamically after edits to reflect the current state of extended content.

version.releaseNotes:
This bug-fix release includes a number of small usability fixes to improve the user experience. See the change-log for details.
Upgrades from versions prior to 2.2.4.0 require running system updaters located under Admin Tools --> Segue Updates.
This Segue release uses Harmoni 1.8.1 and Polyphony 1.4.6.
version.fix: Tagging: Fixed erroneous title when viewing all tags added by everyone within all of Segue.
Access Log: Fixed spelling mistake that was preventing a DuplicateKeyDatabaseException from being caught.
Media: File URLs now include the file name at the end for clarity and to support usage by the FlowPlayer.
Roles: Users now cannot accidentally revoke their own administrator access.
Text-Templates: GoogleCalendar text-template now works with multiple calendars again. The issue was that the embed code was changed to drop the "http:" at the beginning of the source url.
version.new: UI2: Can now open options-panel by holding down CTRL and SHIFT while clicking on content or containers.
version.change: UI2: Clicking off on an options panel now closes it.
version.fix: UI2: Controls links now properly hide along with the bar.
UI2: Controls-bar now spans the width of its item.
UI2: Controls-bar now is fixed width. It right-aligned on wide items and left-aligned on items narrower than its width to always keep it close while still accessible.
Portal: Folder icons now displayed again.
version.change: UI2: Tightened up margins and borders in arrange mode.
version.fix: Themes: Removed extra padding around menus.

version.releaseNotes:
This release includes a large number of usability improvements that make Segue usage much more smooth.
Notable User-Facing changes:
* New 'Recently Visited' folder * The current portal folder and many settings are now remembered. * New media library buttons in the Text and Images plugin make it much easier to insert images and add links to files. * Permissions icons are now shown in edit-mode and in the media library. * The move/copy process has be renamed to better fit with the copy/paste metaphor of usage. * The selection panel now is always shown. * The window now scrolls when dragging in Arrange mode.
See the change log for more details and other improvements.
Upgrades from versions prior to 2.2.4.0 require running system updaters located under Admin Tools --> Segue Updates.
----
This Segue 2 release uses Harmoni 1.8.0 and Polyphony 1.4.5.
version.new: Agent: Now supports IP-range-based group membership. Configure in segue/config/agent.conf.php
Portal: New 'Recently Visited' folder.
version.important: Run the 'Access Log' updater under Admin Tools -> Segue Updates.
version.new: Portal: The current portal folder is now remembered so that users get returned to the same folder each time they go to the portal.
version.important: Run the 'User Data' updater under Admin Tools -> Segue Updates.
version.new: Choice of 'Classic Mode' or 'New Mode' is now stored across sessions.
version.fix: Selection: Removing an item now doesn't jump to the top of the page.
version.change: Selection: The selection panel is now visible in view-mode and on the portal.
Selection/Move-Copy: '+ Selection' button renamed to 'Copy', '+ Move/Copy' renamed to 'Paste'.
Selection: When an item is selected the 'Copy' button now is highlighted by a border.
Selection/Move-Copy: Sections and Pages are now differentiated in the Selection and Paste panels.
Move-Copy: Now only shows controls if there are selected items.
version.new: Move-Copy: Now remembers all paste-panel settings persistently.
version.fix: UI2: 'Copy' and 'Options' links are now always shown in to controls bar rather than only when the bar itself is moused-over.
UI2: Window now scrolls when dragging items in 'Arrange' mode.
version.new: MediaLibrary: The Textblock and FileForDownload plugins now include buttons below the FCKEditor for inserting images and links to files.
version.change: TextBlock: Now remembers setting for plain-text editor or rich-text editor.
version.new: MediaLibrary: Authoriztion icons are now displayed for files in the media library.
Roles: Authorization icons are now displayed in edit mode to give editors an idea of what is public and what is private.
version.change: Performance: Added pre-caching optimization to site viewing actions to reduce the number of queries needed.

version.releaseNotes:
This release fixes a number of small bugs and usability issues.
----
This Segue 2 release uses Harmoni 1.7.0 and Polyphony 1.4.4.
version.fix: Migration: Segue v2 to v1 URL resolver now does not add extra slashes to the URL.
Roles: search field in Roles UI is now labelled and includes instructions for use.
UI2: title fields have been increased in size to accommodate more title text.
UI2: options box title bar now no longer obscures block, page or section titles.
Wiki: File-URL writing now puts the repository first to keep it out of display in the browser's title-bar.

version.releaseNotes:
This release fixes several issues that were in 2.2.1.
----
This Segue 2 release uses Harmoni 1.7.0 and Polyphony 1.4.3.
version.fix: Portal: Now hiding edit links when not authenticated to help exclude crawlers.
Errors: UnknownActionException now gives a 404 error instead of a 400.
Slots: Fixed infinite loop in course-owner merging.

version.releaseNotes:
This release improves the speed of searching for sites in the portal as well as fixes a number of minor bugs.
Notable user-facing changes: * speed improvements in the portal * Audio Clip plugin can now be used in comments.
See the change log for more details on these and other fixes.
----
This Segue 2 release uses Harmoni 1.7.0 and Polyphony 1.4.3.
version.fix: Slots/Portal: Slots/Placeholders are now only merged with external owner lists when owners are requested rather than when the slot is instantiated. This change means that searching for slots in the portal doesn't require loading course information.
Plugins: Fixed PHP notice in Next/Previous Links.
Comments: AudioPlayer plugin can now be used for comments.
Portal: Fixed PHP notice in Portal search.
Portal: removed the "All Editable" folder because it is too slow.

version.releaseNotes:
This Release adds several new plugins, a number of user-interface and RSS improvements, and numerous fixes.
Notable User-facing changes:
* New Audio Clip plugin * RSS feeds now include enclosures for File for Download and Audio Clip plugins. * RSS feeds now include tags.
See the change log for more details on these and other fixes.
----
This Segue 2 release uses Harmoni 1.7.0 and Polyphony 1.4.3.
version.new: Plugins: New Audio Clip plugin.
version.change: MediaLibrary: Can now limit selection to certain MIME Types.
version.new: Plugins: New plugin methods available for accessing media from Flash while maintaining session-based authentication of the file-access.
Plugins: New Next/Previous links plugin for auto-creating links between pages in a section.
version.change: Plugins: File-for-download now uses the FCKEditor and puts the caption below the file rather than above.
version.new: RSS/Plugins: Download and Audio Clip plugins now support enclosures in the RSS feeds.
RSS: RSS feeds now include tags.
version.change: Roles/View: Roles link is now shown in view mode as well as edit mode, whenever the user is authorized to see roles on the current node.
version.fix: Roles: Fixed NullArgumentException in Roles UI when entering from the site-level.
version.new: UI2: Options links now have more agreeable spacing.
version.fix: UI2: History link is now available under 'Options' so that it is accessible when titles are hidden.
Themes: Fixed spelling mistake in UI.

Plugins: Now allowing Local URLs outside of href tags to be converted.
Commit 4b01672feaf80a6cef6d3df4f68293369ebde587 (2.1.0) went a little too far and broke local-url tokenization for File and RSS plugins that need to tokenize plain URLs.

version.releaseNotes:
This release updates site URLs to include the site/placeholder name to improve the sense of context by users. Additionally, this release includes 'Meebo' chat widget support as well as a number of fixes.
See the change-log for details of these fixes.
----
This Segue 2 release uses Harmoni 1.6.2 and Polyphony 1.4.2.
version.change: View/UI1/UI2: Site-name is now included in all site-viewing urls to provide context to users.
version.new: Text-Templates: Added support for embedded Meebo chat widget. http://www.meebome.com/
Help: Added new help documentation for adding content; adding pages and sections; and for using the Rich-Text Editor.
version.fix: Plugins: Local-URLs as plain-text instead of link href values now don't break HTML formatting. Local URLs are now only tokenized if they are used in an href, src or other tag, not just plain text.
version.change: View: When users request a node that doesn't exist and have a site parameter in the URL, they are given a link to the main page of the site.
version.fix: UI1/UI2: Empty Section UI message now refers to link text of "+ Page".
UI1: Updated menu addition text from "+ Menu Item" to "+ Page" for consistency with UI2.
Login form now says Username/Email instead of just 'username'.

version.releaseNotes:
This bug fix release fixes an error in editing multi-lingual text in 'new mode' as well as a minor Segue 1 redirect issue.
See the change-log for details of these fixes.
----
This Segue 2 release uses Harmoni 1.6.1 and Polyphony 1.4.1.
version.fix: UI2: Non-ASCII UTF-8 text was getting improperly encoded when doing an AJAX form submission. Now using the proper encodeURIComponent() method instead of the escape() method.
Migration: Now redirecting segue 1 urls even if they include encoded ampersands.

version.releaseNotes:
This first stable release of Segue 2 fixes a number of issues that were found during testing of the release candidates.
Notable user-facing changes:
* Now supports embedded GoogleCalendars. * Now supports links targeting pop-up windows. * YouTube videos now can be loaded in high quality using the fmt=18 option. * A warning is now given if leaving a page with a text-editor open.
See the change-log for details of these and other fixes.
----
Upgrades:
As of beta 25, Segue requires PHP to be compiled with XSL support. On unix systems this can be added by configuring PHP using the --with-xsl option. See the following for installation instructions: http://www.php.net/manual/en/xsl.installation.php
Upgrades from versions prior to beta 30 require running system updaters located under Admin Tools --> Segue Updates.
----
This Segue 2 release uses Harmoni 1.6.1 and Polyphony 1.4.1.
version.fix: Themes: Border color and style options for Bevelbox theme now apply to content block heading.
UI2: changed minimal width of options layer from 200px to 150px.
Migration: Segue 1 redirects now work for RSS feeds and site-names with hyphens.
Migration: Local URLs are now updated to point a new locations.
Dataport: Admin-only import tool now works again.
UI2: Ajax plugin updates now do not result in a null-argument exception.

Re-applied a set of changes that should have been in beta 28, but that got accidentally dropped during resolution of a merge conflict.
* Plugins: Text-Plugin now prompts with confirmation before unloading the page (back, refresh, link-click, etc) when the plugin is open for editing in UI2. * Improved XML error checking in RSS feed display. * Removed debugging lines. * Placeholder admin screens now remember pagination state.
UI2: Block controls now are above header so that they don't hide reorder and history links.
version.new: Text-Templates: New text template for popup-windows enables usage of links that spawn popup windows as created by the FCKEditor.
Text-Templates can now optionally flag themselves as 'WYSIWYG editor safe' so that their HTML can be modified in the FCKEditor and then converted back to markup for storage and filtering.
version.change: Text-Templates now support multi-valued arguments. Needed for allowing multiple Google-Calendars.
version.new: Text-Templates: New GoogleCalendar text-template.
version.change: Text-Templates: Youtube text-template now supports the fmt (format) option which can take '18' as a value to get a high-quality video.

version.releaseNotes:
This release fixes a number of small bugs and a number of security issues.
Security issues fixed:
* Cross-Site Request Forgeries (CSRF) are now eliminated from data-modification actions. Read about CSRF at: http://shiflett.org/articles/cross-site-request-forgeries * Segue can now be configured to use secure/http-only cookies. * Admin actions are now restricted to prevent listing of users and ids in the system.
version.fix: Errors: Fixed unknown index notice in the SegueErrorPrinter.

Slots/Placeholders: Now folds slot names to lowercase when looking up.
Segue 1 had some instances of uppercase slot-names that were causing errors in migration and redirects.
Migration: Redirects to Segue 1 now properly include the 'site' action when short-form URLs ('/sites/sitename') are used.
version.change: Security: Actions that involve data modification now require per-user tokens in the request to prevent Cross-Site Request Forgeries.
Now welcome message is configurable.

version.releaseNotes:
This first production release candidate of Segue 2 fixes a number of user-interface difficulties and adds much documentation.
Notable User-Facing Changes:
* Can now search for sites in the Portal by title, description, or placeholder * More contextual help. * New 'Blank' template. * Can now set site-wide roles and theme when creating a site. * Roles links have been moved to the top of the screen for easier access.
----
Upgrades:
As of beta 25, Segue requires PHP to be compiled with XSL support. On unix systems this can be added by configuring PHP using the --with-xsl option. See the following for installation instructions: http://www.php.net/manual/en/xsl.installation.php
Upgrades from versions prior to beta 30 require running system updaters located under Admin Tools --> Segue Updates.
----
Segue 2.0.0 uses Harmoni 1.5.0 and Polyphony 1.3.3.
version.new: Portal: Can now search for sites by title, description, or placeholder.

Can now split sites to different virtual-hosts or paths based on their location category. This enables sites given the 'main' location-category to appear at a different url from sites given the 'community' location-category.
Site Creation: Added a new 'Blank' template
Site Creation: Can now set site-wide roles and choose theme in create-site wizard.
New course-sites listing action to provide listings of course sites to external systems.
version.fix: Help: Added new help documentation for Portal, Copy-Site, Move/Copy, Wiki-Linking, and Text-Templates.
version.change: Roles: Renamed all references to 'Permissions' to 'Roles' for consistency.
UI2: Roles-link has now been moved to the commands area at the top of the page for easier access. Also added to that area for Classic mode.
UI1/UI2: TextBlock and Download plugins renamed to 'Text & Images' and 'File'.
version.fix: UI2: Now can not delete layout containers that are targets for menus as this would through the site into an invalid state.
Fixed a number of notices that were filling up the logs when the MSNBot crawled Segue.

version.releaseNotes:
This release fixes a number of security issues, an authorization bug that was prevent proper view access to some sites, and a few smaller issues. As well, it introduces the ability to move or copy content and pages within a site or across sites. See the change-log for details.
Notable User-Facing Changes:

version.releaseNotes:
This release adds support for embedded Flash videos, text-templates, and fixes several bugs.
Text-templates are a new extension system that use the same markup as MediaWiki's templates to enable output of custom HTML blocks customized with a set of named parameters.
For example, a new 'video' template inserts embed code for videos from a variety of providers defined in a white-list (to prevent XSS attacks). Example of usage: {{video|service=youtube|id=s13dLaTIHSg|width=425|height=344}} This video template will also search through the HTML source in a text-block and replace any embed or object elements with appropriate template markup.
Also included is a 'search' template that can insert a customized search field into a text-block. Example of usage: {{search}} Example of usage: {{search|base_url=http://youtube.com/results|search_param_name=search_query}}
See the change-log for additional details on fixes.

version.fix:
Roles: Fixed Roles issue with 'invalid default state'.
It appears that since the transition to the new AuthZ2 implementation, the roles system has not been working correctly when setting complex authorization. This issue stems from the 'new' property of view authorizations cascading up as well as down. This cascading up was confusing the roles system. When there was no site-wide view authorization the roles system thought that there was due to a view authorization cascading up from a story or page.
This has now been sorted out and the roles system only looks at implicit authorizations that cascade down when determining what role to display for a user.

Run the RSS display updater under Admin Tools -> Segue Updates to enable the RssFeed plugin.
version.change: View/Portal: Major speed improvements for non-editor and non-logged in users. Now only checking 'add_children' authorization for determining when to show mode-switching links, saving dramatically on the number of authorization queries when all such queries return false. As well, mode-switching-link checks will simply be bypassed if the user is not authenticated to prevent even more authorization queries.
version.fix: Starting Site: Now doesn't require a second click to access other parts of the site when using a custom starting site.
Authentication: Failed login followed by successful login now doesn't retain the 'login failed' message.
version.change:
Roles: With 'Editor' role set for 'everyone' log-in is required to edit.
To accomplish this, the role-system now merges authorizations for the 'edu.middlebury.agents.everyone' group and the 'edu.middlebury.agents.users' group when viewing or setting roles for 'Everyone'.
The 'edu.middlebury.agents.everyone' group (which includes the anonymous user) is only ever given the 'reader' role (view authorization) and the view_comments authorization (part of the 'commenter' role) while the 'edu.middlebury.agents.users' group (which includes all authenticated users, even visitors) is given the additional authorizations.
As far as the UI is concerned site admins are just setting roles for 'Everyone', but now anonymous users aren't being given grants to make changes. This should prevent spam and make modifications at least nominally traceable.

This release of Segue 2.0-beta adds visitor registration, theme migration, and a number of bug fixes.
Visitor registration (disabled in the default configuration) enables external users to register for visitor accounts that will all them to participate in public discussions.
Theme migration has been added to allow Segue 1 sites to retain their theme settings when they are migrated to Segue 2.
This release also includes several new themes.
Upgrades from versions prior to beta 22 require running the appropriate updater located under Admin Tools --> Segue Updates. As well, the authentication configuration files have change and will need to be updated.
version.change:
Config: Reorganized authentication configuration to allow more flexibility.
Authentication configuration is now broken into 5 files: * The overall setup file that usually won't be changed - authentication_setup * The list of authentication sources - authentication_sources * A file for each authentication source - authentication-XXXX
This new setup will allow for less confusion between the default configurations of basic types and custom configurations of LDAP, secondary types.
version.new:
Visitor Registration: Visitor registration system is now in place to allow visitors to register with a Segue instance. A reCAPTCHA check is done at registration-time and email-address confirmation is required to help prevent abuse.
You will need to sign up for a reCAPTCHA API key.

version.new: Migration/Import/Export: Block and menu display-styles are included in export, import, and migration operations.
version.fix: Migration: Removed hard-coded reference to the 'Middlebury LDAP' authentication type.
Portal: Classes load time partially sped up for some students.

Portal: Speed improvements

This release of Segue adds theming choices for sites. Site-editors can now choose between a number of built-in themes, each of which supports a number of options for changing color scheme and/or fonts.
Additionally, local copies of any theme can be created for a site. These copies enable site-editors to modify the CSS and HTML templates that define a theme, enabling full customization for users familiar with CSS and HTML. In a future release we will eventually add a public gallery of themes that users will be able to submit their themes to and choose themes for their sites from.
New themes in this release: Rounded Corners, Shadow Box, Tabs.
Usage of this new theming system requires running the appropriate updater located under Admin Tools --> Segue Updates.

This release of Segue 2.0 includes dramatic speed improvements over beta 19.1 due to a new implementation of Harmoni's Authorization and Hierarchy system. Usage of this new systems requires running the appropriate updater located under Admin Tools --> Segue Updates. version.new:
AuthZ2: New Authorization/Hierarchy package stores implicit authorizations as rows in their own table so that they can be quickly read at the expense of a small increase in writing time and storage space.
Usage of this new systems requires running the appropriate updater located under Admin Tools --> Segue Updates. This updater will take several minutes to run and will make irrevocable changes to your database. Please back up your database before running this updater.
Please note that in AuthZ2 the 'edu.middlebury.authorization.view' function has the property of cascading up the hierarchy as well as down. This property is needed by our Segue and Concerto applications and the lack of it in the original implementations required the use of the isAuthorizedBelow() function. All other authorization functions cascade down only.

version.fix: Migration: nav block now no longer catches exceptions from below and so plugin errors now halt import.

This allows new installations to have their database tables created in one execution cycle and then have their services configured in the second cycle.

SiteDisplay: New algorithm for determining if parts of the site are in a 'header' or 'footer' role allows for more variation in the arrangement of 'headers' and 'footers', not requiring there to be only one-cell of each.
SiteMap: Fixed HTML errors.
Tagging: Now cannot add tags in tag-viewing screens or edit-mode if no AZ to modify the item.
version.change: Tagging: Added tagging controls to classic mode.
Tagging: Tag cloud now appears at the bottom of the content block.
version.fix: Roles: The '?' info links for disabled roles now do not confuse group-caused roles with globally set roles and now properly list the groups causing the implicit role.

Comments: Now limiting plugins to a list of appropriate plugin types. Not allowing system-plugins like RSS and BreadCrumbs as these would break things in their attempts to traverse up the site hierarchy from the comment.
Plugins: If exceptions occur during plugin execution an error is displayed, but the page doesn't halt.
Comments: Download plugin now works in comments.

version.releaseNotes:
This release fixes a number of bugs and adds a new Portal display.
Notable user-facing changes: * Portal 'Folders' to break up the lists of sites * Major speed improvements to the portal * Comment authors are now preserved when migrating from Segue 1 * URLs to elsewhere in Segue now work more reliably when migrating from Segue 1.
Segue 2.0 beta 17 uses Polyphony 1.0.6 and Harmoni 1.0.6.
version.fix: Migration: Local URLs are now resolved in migration or pointed at a resolver action for run-time redirection if they are external to the site.
Migration: Comment authors are now preserved when migrating from Segue 1 to Segue 2.
Migration: Forced migration table columns to be 50% width, so buttons shouldn't jump when clicked.
Fixed UI switcher to include pagination from flow organizer.
Fixed change UI mode selector in portal so that it properly changes the UI without throwing an error.
Portal/Slots: entering an existing slot name into the 'create-slot' form now doesn't give the user an error-screen.
version.change: CourseManagement/Portal: Added session-caching of user's courses, halving loading time of class-site lists.
Removed unused right column from the main window.
version.new: Portal: New Folder-View for portal. This speeds loading and provides for easier finding of sites.
version.change: Migration: Site importing is now logged.
Migration: Can now get site from import.
version.fix: Breadcrumbs/RSS: Namespaces are now properly set when generating links. This was broken in beta 17.
Versioning: fixing up action to use the new SiteDispatcher.
Slots: Updated default config to reflect actual groups.
version.change: UI1: Removed unused ui1.content_rss action.

version.releaseNotes:
This release fixes a number of bugs to avoid errors in RSS feeds, Wiki-Text in comments, and the site map. As well, short-form URLs now work with placeholder names that contain hyphens and under-scores.
Segue 2.0 beta 17 uses Polyphony 1.0.5 and Harmoni 1.0.5.
version.fix: Comments/WikiText: Wiki-links in comments now don't cause error.
version.change: Plugins: Now can attach a related site component to a plugin for use in resolving wiki links.
version.fix: RSS: Removed header and footer blocks from RSS feeds.
WikiText: fixed wiki-text matching so that matches in the sub-menus of other navigational nodes are found.
UI1: Deleting a parent node no longer causes an error.
version.change: View/UI1/UI2/Roles/RSS: Re-factored access to the current node and the site director to move all access to a new SiteDispatcher class in the view module. Now use methods: SiteDispatcher::getCurrentNode(), SiteDispatcher::getCurrentNodeId(), SiteDispatcher::getCurrentRootNode(), SiteDispatcher::getDirector().
version.fix: View: Fixed site map so that header and footer items are labelled.
View: Fixed site map so that sub-menu items are displayed.
Site Display: Fixed RSS feeds of navigational nodes with sub-menus so that content blocks in sub-menus are also included in the feed.
Short-form urls of the style '/sites/siteName' now work with site names that contain hyphens and underscores.
Migration: Fixes to allow migration to work on servers with high security settings.

version.releaseNotes:
This release adds Media Library quotas and enables redirects from Segue 1 instances.
Segue 2.0 beta 16 uses Polyphony 1.0.5 and Harmoni 1.0.5.
version.fix: View: Now doesn't throw an error when viewing restricted sites while not logged in. Included a missing class.
version.new: Migration: New action for reporting the existence of a site to a Segue 1 instance. With Segue 1.9.1, this allows forwarding from a Segue 1 instance to the Segue 2 instance in addition to forwarding in the other direction (supported in 2.0-beta 15/1.9.0).
version.fix: Migration: Now can accept Segue 1-style URLs to Segue 2 sites that were created in the Segue 2 instance and not imported.
version.new: MediaLibrary: Quotas are now displayed in the media library and enforced by the upload actions.

version.releaseNotes: This release fixes a little bug introduce in beta 15.
version.fix: SiteDisplay: Fixed cascading settings.

version.releaseNotes:
The Segue 2.0 beta is capable of most of the site creation and editing needs of users. We are continually adding features to bring Segue 2 up to feature parity with Segue 1.x. See the Feature Request Tracker for a list of features that still need to be completed: https://sourceforge.net/tracker/?group_id=82171&atid=565237
This release adds a number of major improvements as well as fixes a large number of bugs.
Notable user-facing changes: * Migration tools for importing Segue 1 sites * New plugins for Breadcrumbs and RSS links * Improvements to UI2, 'New Mode' editing interface to reduce visual clutter. * New Site-Map view. * New version of FCK editor, now supports Safari.
Upgrade Notes: For upgrades from releases prior to beta 15, please run the updates located under Admin Tools --> Segue Updates.
Segue 2.0 beta 15 uses Polyphony 1.0.4 and Harmoni 1.0.5.
version.new: View: added settings for displaying block create and update time-stamps, as well as names of block creators and editors
version.fix: Versioning: Fixed history action to use new view module
version.new: Importer/Migration: Site migration tools to allow users to import Segue 1 sites.

URLs/Migration: A URL resolver has been added that can redirect Segue 1-style urls. If the Segue 1 site has bee imported into Segue 2 then the user will be redirected to the Segue 2 version, otherwise, they will be redirected to the Segue 1 instance.
This feature allows Segue 2 to be placed at the previous location of a Segue 1 instance (e.g. http://segue.example.edu) and the Segue 1 instance to be moved to a new location (e.g. http://segue1.example.edu). With this switch, Segue 2 will be able to forward old urls to either new versions or to the Segue 1 instance for the duration of a migration period.
View/UI1/UI2: added a view module with unified view actions and redirected view actions in UI1 and UI2 to it.
version.change: View: Added link to site map in site footer.
version.new: View: added javascript to site map link in footer so that link opens in a new sized window and site map links open in window that was the source of the link.
View: Added module and action for displaying a site map.
version.change: Slots: Slots are now defined by a 'Slot' interface to allow for implementation from outside of this package.
Slots: Slot fetching is now cached for the execution cycle to speed repeated access.
version.new: Slots: Now media-upload quotas can be set for sites.
version.change: UI1/UI2: Updated FCKeditor from version 2.4.3 to 2.5.1 This version of this editor now works in Safari and Opera web browsers
UI1/UI2: now passes current node id to breadcrumbs
UI1/UI2: Site Template now uses the new Breadcrumbs and RSS plugins.
UI2: refined the layout of UI2 settings.
version.fix: UI2: fixed UI2 so that site options appear in arrange mode
UI2: Now UI2 gives the same error as UI1 when no site exists with the placeholder name given.
UI2: Fixed invalid markup in ui2 edit commands display.
UI2: Fixed footer width in ui2.
UI2: Edit mode detail view now doesn't show hidden titles in header.
UI2: Fixed issue where containers couldn't be added to the first cell of a layout organizer.
UI2: Fixed Insert form HTML syntax.
version.change: UI2: Header and footer controls are now hidden in default edit mode.
version.new: UI2: New action for only editing header and footer.
Plugins: added a RSS links plugin
Plugins: added breadcrumbs plugin
version.fix: Plugins: PluginManager now adds newly enabled plugins to the session cache as such.
version.change: Plugins: Versions and Content now are stored in LONGBLOB fields to allow more than 64kB of data.
version.fix: Plugins: TextBlock plugin's 'Add Image' and 'Add File' buttons now work in the plain-text editor in IE.
version.important: Plugin data changes require execution of a Segue update -- located under Admin Tools --> Segue Updates.
version.new: WikiText: Now supports [[fileurl:asset_id=1234&record_id=5678]] syntax for urls to files.
version.change: MediaLibrary: Default repository id 'edu.middlebury.segue.sites_repository' is now used if no repository id is specified.
MediaLibrary: Now is more flexible of id-strings, supporting both plain and escaped ampersands as well as 'asset_id' in addition to 'assetId'.
version.fix: Comments: added argument validation
Comments: fixed html markup
version.change: Comments: can now get comment body without editing controls
version.new: Site Display: added link to RSS feeds
version.fix: Site Display: Fixed error in FlowOrgaizer sorting when sort-keys were not unique.
Site Display: Site-level comment-enabling now works.
Site Display: Removed debugging lines from component saving methods.
version.new: RSS: new actions for publishing RSS of content and comments.
version.fix: Importer: Fixed notice when invalid archives are uploaded.
version.new: Importer: Now can import media quotas.
Importer: Can now display status during import.
version.fix: ErrorPrinter: Now doesn't try to send headers if they are already sent.

version.releaseNotes:
This release fixes a few bugs in the permissions UI and fixes some HTML validation errors.
Notable Changes: * Permissions are more reliable cross-browser * File downloads now work in IE * Download Plugin description now updates immediately after change.
version.fix: Roles: Now include needed classes directly so that there are not errors when the user gets logged out.
version.change: SiteDisplay: Now throws a NullArgumentException if no site or node is specified rather than a generic Error.
Adding PHP configuration documentation to the INSTALL.txt file.
version.fix: Permissions: Modify Roles buttons now work in Firefox and Safari again. The previous fix for IE broke the buttons in Firefox and Safari.
Fixed some HTML validation errors.
Plugins: File for Download description now updates immediately after being changed.

version.releaseNotes:
This release fixes a number of Javascript bugs that were preventing some site editing and commenting actions from working for users of Safari and InternetExplorer.
Also in this release are some improvements to the logging system that allow filtering of some errors (such as from web-crawlers) and the graphing of Segue usage statistics.
See the change log for details on further fixes and improvements.
Segue 2.0 beta 13 uses Harmoni 1.0.2 and Polyphony 1.0.1.
version.fix: MediaLibrary: Fixed Safari Javascript error.
version.new: Logging: Now can view graphs of usage statistics.
version.change: Basket: Hiding 'basket'/'selection' from display as it isn't in use yet.
Added more documentation about the license and included libraries.
version.fix: Portal: Now doesn't show 'arrange' option in classic mode.
Editing UI: 'Edit Site Options' and 'Permissions' buttons now work in IE.
UI: Now displays an unauthorized error if the user is not authorized to access any part of a site, hiding the site title.
Editing UI: Now does not display menu help if the user is not authorized to add content to the menu.
UI2: Now does not display empty content organizers when the user is not authorized to view or add content to them.
UI2: Fixed IE7 'Add Content' button error.
SiteDisplay: If users only have access to later menu items, then the first of those will now be shown by default instead of no menu items selected at all.
version.new: Logging: Can now filter certain UserAgent/Exception combinations to prevent web-crawlers from filling up logs with repeated invalid requests.

version.releaseNotes:
This Segue beta release fixes a number of issues discovered in testing the previous beta release.
Notable Improvements: Clean installs now work. Comments and MediaLibrary now work in InternetExplorer. Rich-Text Editor now uses the custom configuration properly. Invalid requests now generate HTTP error codes to indicate to web-crawlers that their request is invalid. Error pages are now friendlier. Cookie values are no longer added to URLs.
Segue 2.0 beta 12 uses Harmoni 1.0.1 and Polyphony 1.0.1.
version.fix: DataPort: Added 'Author' role to the site schema.
UI2: Removed the ability to manually create a submenus from the arrange-mode UI. Submenus can now only be created as multi-component collections, the same as in edit-mode and classic-mode.
MediaLibrary: Fixed a NULL_VALUE notice in the MediaLibrary that was appearing in Safari.
MediaLibrary: Now works in InternetExplorer browsers.
version.change: URLs: MYURL constant is now configurable via a config file.
URLs: POLYPHONY_PATH constant by default is now based on the MYPATH constant rather than the MYURL constant to allow more flexibility in the URL structure.
version.fix: XHTML Output: Fixed a syntax error on the welcome page.
UI1: Rich-Text editor (FCKEditor) now is using the custom toolbar config.
version.change: UI1: Create Item links now include the option name to differentiate them.
Logging: Added additional logging of user actions.
version.new: Added a favicon.gif to the images/ directory.
version.fix: Installation: Fixed a Harmoni issue that was preventing successful clean installation.
Comments: IE users can now choose the comment type.
Plugins: Now AJAX-updating doesn't return the user to the top of the page.
version.new: Uncaught exceptions now result in HTTP error codes being sent and a nicer error page being display during production use.

version.releaseNotes: This release fixes a few bugs that were noticed in testing beta 10.
version.fix: SiteDisplay: Fixed error in Block-In-Menu titles when no content is added.

SiteDisplay: Reordering and moving now works again. In Beta 10 whitespace was added to the stored XML for legibility purposes. The whitespace is now stripped out of the working document during site-modification.
UI2: Fixed error that was causing new content blocks to be added to the top of the ContentOrganizer.
SiteDisplay: Removed some debugging lines.
Portal: Now doesn't re-encode html entities in Site titles.
Plugins: WikiText Links generated in ajax editing response now go to the appropriate module and action.
Plugins: PluginManager now respects the order of the plugin-type ids. Still need the ability to change the plugin order from the admin UI, but at least order can be manually set in the database now.

version.releaseNotes:
This release includes fixes to a large number of bugs. In addition to a few new changes and improvements.
Notable user-facing changes: Media library should be much more stable. Authors and editors now always get links to edit-mode. Now can reliably use path_info-based urls as the primarily URL scheme. Admin-only export/import tools to allow migration of sites.
Notable back-end changes: Updated to Harmoni 1.0.0. Internal links are now parsed and tokenized to improve mobility of the content.
Segue 2.0 beta 10 uses Harmoni 1.0.0 and Polyphony 1.0.0.
version.change: A number of small fixes to allow working with Harmoni 1.0.0's move to pure OSID interfaces.
version.new: Export: New site-export tool that provides a downloadable XML representation of the site and its media.
Import: New site-import tool that can import from an XML representation of the site and its media.
Plugins: New plugin methods to support mapping of Ids as sites are imported.

Plugins: Now support 'tokenizing' of internal links. This translates links from the form:
http://segue.example.edu/index.php?module=ui1&action=view&node=12345
to a wiki-style token that can be more easily found, replaced, or translated when exporting/importing sites:
[[localurl:module=ui1&action=view&node=12345]]
WikiText: Now supports [[localurl:xxxxx]] for of url-tokens.
version.fix: WikiText: Links to add missing pages now land on a page with a message rather than throwing an unknown action exception.
index.php: Now MYPATH constant is set to the SCRIPT_PATH instead of PHP_SELF to work better when using path info-based URLs.
Editing UI: People with author/editor roles below the site root now get links to edit-mode.
version.change: Site Display: Can now get the content type of a block. This matches the plugin type.
Site Display: Asset-based site components now use the PHP5 DOM libraries instead of the DOMIT libraries that had been needed under PHP4.
version.fix: A URL that requires javascript processing now isn't placed in a form action, preventing web-crawlers form accidentally going to an invalid URL.
History: Now catches if no versions are specified.
History: Links to other parts of the site Hierarchy now go back to the appropriate module and action.
version.change: Comments: The CommentManager now checks the authorization of the asset the thread is attached to rather than looking at the request.
Comments: Can now return the asset for a CommentNode to enable export.
version.fix: Comments: Added a note to the UI that comments can be edited until there are replies.
version.change: Can now get the Segue version string during execution.
version.fix: MediaLibrary: Failed thumbnail generation for multi-page PDF files no longer causes an error in the MediaLibrary.

version.releaseNotes: This release fixes a number of bugs in the Roles user interface. See the change-log for details.
version.change: Themes: Sub-menus are now indented more to improve clarity. Indent is now 17px.
version.fix: Permissions: Now components without titles do not crash the Manage Roles user interface.
Permissions: Now nested menus are traversed-to when populating the Roles Matrix.
Permissions: Groups are now not duplicated in search results.
Permissions: Now can display more info about users and groups in case the names are not unique.

version.releaseNotes:
This release clarifies the role of slots/site-placeholders and brings some performance improvements to the portal page, especially for users with large numbers of course sites.
This version also adds versioning support for content blocks and programatic sorting of content to enable blogging.
Upgrade Notes: The icons/ directory has been renamed to images/ to prevent conflicts with the Apache system icons directory. Be sure to run the Segue Updaters under Admin tools to update the table structure to support versioning.
Segue 2.0 beta 8 uses Polyphony 0.10.7 and Harmoni 0.13.7.
version.important: Run the Updaters under Admin Tools --> Segue Updates to update the table structure.
version.change: Classic Mode UI: Now 'Add Image' and 'Add File' buttons are hidden when using the FCK editor.
version.new: Site Display: Can now programatically order content blocks by title, create date, or modification date, all ascending or descending.
New versioning system for plugin-content. Optionally supported by individual plugins.
version.change: Slots: Added documentation to Admin UI.
Slots: Can now change the type of a slot when editing or adding.
version.fix:
Portal/Slots: Have cut the load time by ~2/3. From 30 seconds to 11 seconds.
The big overhead that is now skipped was checking the ownership status of all members of a class rather than just the current user.
Slots: Now internally and externally defined slots are merged properly so that all intended owners are given authorizations.
Slots: Added a unique-key to the slot-owner table to prevent duplicate entries.
Portal/Slots: Now edit and delete links are not shown for course sites if the user doesn't have authorization to take action on the site.
version.change: Site Creation: Can now select which slot owners are given Admin access to a new site at time of create.
Moved the 'icons/' subdirectory to 'images/' to prevent collision with the Apache system-icons directory when installing Segue in the web-server root.

version.releaseNotes: This release fixes a large number of bugs as well as improves the validity of the XHTML markup generated by Segue.
version.fix: CourseInformation: Now mal-formed course codes should not prevent the portal from displaying.
version.new: Plugins: New descriptive methods in plugins.
Plugins: Can now determine if a plugin type is installed and/or enabled.
version.fix: Failed login now displays a message and logout now redirects properly.
General improvements to validity of XHTML markup.
Portal: Now shows a generic portal to non-logged-in users with a not that they should log in to see their own portal.
Portal: Empty site categories are now hidden.
Portal: 'Create New Site' button for admins has been removed since it was an unneeded hold-over from early testing.
Slots: 'Slots' are now named 'placeholders' in the UI.
Slots: 'delete placeholder' link in portal now works.
UI2: Options in 'Add Menu Item' list are now categorized.
UI1/UI2: 'Page with Sidebar' option is now not as prominently listed.
version.change: UI1/UI2: When editing a page and viewing and empty menu, instructions are now printed to the screen describing how to add a Content Page on which content can be added.

UI2: Upgraded Scriptaculous library to latest version and moved the overridden Draggables.isAffected() method to the ArrangeModeVisitor where it is used, allowing a plain vanilla Scriptaculous library to be included in the source.
UI2: Arrange mode now shows the move-cursor for only draggable items.
UI2: Arrange mode now only allows dragging by the controls bar.
version.fix: UI2: Arrange mode now renders more closely to edit mode. Re-factored Arrange mode visitor to only add its needed additions rather than replicating functions in edit mode.
UI2: Some fixes to the Javascript syntax to aid XHTML validation.
UI2: Added a notice for MSIE < v7 users that New Mode won't work for them.
SiteDisplay: Now cannot drag nav items into their child menus, creating cycles in the hierarchy.
SiteDisplay: Empty NavOrganizers now have a non-null placeholder, so if they don't get filled they won't cause other elements on the page to stretch.
SiteDisplay: Links in text blocks are now underlined and colored.
WikiText: Link titles are now case-insensitive.

version.releaseNotes:
This release fixes a number of bugs as well as provides new admin-tools for the management of slots (site-placeholders). Additionally, security measures have been put in place to prevent cross-site-scripting (XSS) attacks.
For upgrades from earlier releases, please run the update located under Admin Tools --> Segue Updates.
This release of Segue uses Harmoni 0.13.5 and Polyphony 0.10.5.
version.fix: Security: All titles, descriptions, and other user-supplied text is now cleaned to prevent cross-site-scripting (XSS) attacks.
Security: Plugins now strip HTML markup that might give openings for cross-site-scripting (XSS) attacks.
version.important: Existing installations need to have the Segue Update run under Admin Tools --> Segue Updates.
version.new: Slots: New slot-editing and deleting admin interfaces.
Slots: New slot-browsing admin interface.
version.change: Slots: Can now build a list of all slots.
Slots: Now can specify a category for which virtual instance to display a site in main/community.
version.new: New data updater system.
Wiki-Linking: New Wiki-Linking support to use double-square-brackets links a la MediaWiki for link between parts of a site or between sites.
version.fix: Permissions: Titles are now are consistently tabbed using padding.
Permissions: AZs set for all of Segue are now not changeable in the permissions UI.
'Show Titles' and 'Enable Comments' settings are now only 'yes' or 'no' at the root (site) level, so the default setting is clear.
Fixed an error in the change log that was preventing it from displaying.

version.releaseNotes:
This release includes a new hierarchical authorization-setting user interface that allows for the designation of roles to any user or group anywhere in the site hierarchy.
This release uses Harmoni 0.13.4 and Polyphony 0.10.4.
version.new: Permissions: New Hierarchical role-setting UI that can set roles for any user or group across the entire site.
version.fix: UI1: Fixed an issue where Header/Footer sensing was inappropriately thinking that a cell was a footer when it contained a nav-target rather than a nav item. This was leading to an uncaught exception in Classic Mode.
version.change: SiteRendering: Improved the debugging output to help solve an issue.
version.fix: UI2: Arrange-mode no longer asks for confirmation before moving items.

version.releaseNotes:
This release fixes an installer bug that was preventing fresh installs from completing. It also fixes some ArrangeMode bugs that were allowing Menus and MenuItems to be dragged to invalid places.
This release uses Harmoni 0.13.4 and Polyphony 0.10.3.
version.fix: UI2: Menu Items are now filtered from being dropped on their own cells, preventing inadvertent nudges from triggering 'do you want to move' prompts.

UI2: Menus now are not draggable to content organizers.
The issue was an comparison between a string id and an integer id was improperly evaluating to true.
Installer: Moved install script to segue/main/install/ since it isn't really end-user modifiable.
Installer: Now makes authorization service available before install-process runs so that installation happens smoothly.

version.releaseNotes:
This release fixes a large number of bugs and adds role-based authorization-setting user interfaces. As well, the Plugin System had its interface hierarchy reworked.
The major Harmoni improvement is the ability to attach externally-defined groups (such as from LDAP) underneath locally defined groups.
Segue 2.0.0-beta-3 runs on Harmoni 0.13.3 and Polyphony 0.10.3.
Changes to the Agent tables require running a database updater script: segue/main/harmoni/core/DBHandler/db_updater.php
version.new:
Permissions: When users are assigned an 'Author' role, they are automatically given the 'Editor' role of anything that they create.
This allows people to go back and make changes to or delete content that they have added.
Similarly, If a user moves a piece of content from a place where they have an implicit 'Editor' role to a place where they only have an implicit 'Author' role, they are given an explicit 'Editor' role on the newly moved content.
version.change: Logging: Content deleting, creation, and modification are now logged.
Comments: Changes to comments are now logged.
version.fix: UI1: Classic-Mode now doesn't show controls for unimplemented 'move' and 'versions' options.
UI1: Classic-Mode controls now are not shown if the current user does not have authorization to use them.
Comments: Comments can now be edited by users who are not otherwise editors of the site and only have 'comment' authorization.

Comments: Authorizations are now checked before showing 'comment' and 'reply' buttons. Authorization checks have also been added inside the comment manager to ensure that authorizations are respected.
version.change: UI2: 'Controls' are now named 'Options'.
UI2: 'Content Organizers' are now named 'Content Containers'
UI2: 'Fixed Organizers' are now named 'Layout Containers'
version.fix: SiteDisplay: Fixed exception being thrown when adding menus.
UI2/Permissions: UI2 editing actions now properly check authorizations before acting.
version.new: Permissions: New 'Role' system to provide an abstraction over the particular combinations of authorizations.

Permissions: New 'Institute Users' group. This group can have an number of sub-groups or individuals added to it. It represents all users that should be treated together as 'members of the institution'.
Permissions: New Role-setting interface that allows setting the role of 'the world' and 'institute users' throughout the site hierarchy. This UI is part of the classic-mode editing UI.
version.fix: MediaLibrary panel now works in IE. Needed to explicitly add tbody elements to tables.
Fixing a number of E_STRICT notices and improving the class and interface hierarchies.
MediaLibrary: Can now delete files.
MediaLibrary: Thumbnails are now refreshed when uploading new files.
version.change: MediaLibrary: When uploading a replacement file, if the submitted title is the same as the original filename, the title will be updated to the new filename.
Plugins: Reworked the SeguePlugins class hierarchy in order to separate out responsibility areas and enforce method-access and method-overriding restrictions.

version.fix: MediaLibrary: Now extends screen after uploading files.
MediaLibrary: Now displays errors and continues rather than failing.
version.change: MediaLibrary: Now logs exceptions.
version.fix: TextBlock Plugin: Now the Media Library always receives the correct assetId And uploads to the correct Asset.
version.new: Chang-log links and display now work.
version.fix: Footer cleaned up and now showing correct version.
version.change: UI1: 'Edit Site Settings' button is now on the right side of the page.
UI1/UI2: 'Append New...' has been renamed to 'Add Content' or 'Add Menu Item' as appropriate.
UI1/UI2: "2-column page" is now renamed back to "Page with Sidebar". As well, the "sidebar" organizers now have their default widths set to 200px so that they look more like a sidebar.
version.fix: SiteDisplay: Now 'Read More' links aren't shown if no text is present.
version.change: SiteCreation: Default site no longer has a footer.
UI1: Editing controls for header and footer are now hidden in Classic Mode and accessible through the "Site Settings" wizard.
Site visitors now use PHP5-style __construct() methods.
version.fix: SiteDisplay: Titles of content blocks set to "hide" are now hidden if they are not the target content block.
version.change: Now the default main menu has a 200px width setting.
version.fix: SiteDisplay: Now empty content organizers collapse cleanly.
version.new: UI2: Added Classic Mode-style reordering.
version.fix: Trimming extra slashes from the url
version.change: Now using Alex's new theme as the default.
version.fix: Database/Setup: Fixing an uncommitted transaction that was causing transaction-lock-timeouts.
UI1: Reordering forms now appear for all sibling elements.
SiteDisplay: SubMenus with no items now don't stretch to the width of the page.
UI2: Block settings default button is now 'Apply Changes' instead of 'Delete'.
version.change: UI1: Status step placeholder not shown to user.
version.fix: UI2: Now whitespace won't prevent widths from saving.

version.important: As of this version, Segue no longer supports PHP4. Please use PHP5 or later.
version.change: Removing ampersands for compatibility with other PHP5 code. The BBEdit-grep string used for the find and replace was: (function )&|(=\s?)&([^a-z#])|([^&])&\s?(\$) replaced with \1\2\3\4\5
version.important: In order to support PostgreSQL without re-factoring of the Database Handler, column names have been all made lowercase. To update a currently populated harmoni database to the new names, run the following updater script: harmoni/core/DBHandler/db_updater.php
version.change: Libraries: Moved default location of harmoni and polyphony to segue/main/.
version.fix: Comments: Refreshing page after deleting a comment no longer results in an uncaught exception.
TextBlock: Now works with both editors as an AJAX Plugin.
AJAX Plugins: Now updates text-areas that use the FCK Editor before submitting.
TextBlock: Now uses a full-width text field.
TextBlock: Now can reliably switch between editors in non-wizard mode.
Plugins: Fixed some javascript quoting errors.
Media Library: Panel now re-centers as items are added.
Added a warning before deleting sites via the portal.
Fixed SQL statements to work with PostgreSQL.
SiteDisplay: Fixed some assumptions of cells containing Element nodes.
Nav Items can now be deleted without causing errors.
Menus can now be moved without causing errors.
Content can now be appended in arrange mode.

UI1: Adding site editing action to UI1
MediaBrowser: Fixed notice that was causing an XML error.

Plugins now return a description and icon for display to the user.
Added breadcrumbs to the site view.
Ajax updates now respect normal/extended state.
version.change: Detail mode now forces plugin titles to be shown.
version.new: Plugins can now specify a separate/different 'extended content'.
version.change: Creating sub-menus now adds non-nested menus when the parent menu is horizontal.
DOM cache is now cleared when moving/adding/removing site nodes.

Plug-in system added.
Site rendering system added.
Everything is new.

changelog.about: Segue is an open source collaborative content management system designed for e-learning that combines the ease of use of course management systems with the flexibility of weblogs for creating various types of sites including course, news, and journal.
